alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 22 at 4:56AM CDT until April 23 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Black River Near Galesville affecting Trempealeau and La Crosse Counties. Black River at Black River Falls affecting Jackson County. .The combination of snow melt and rainfall has resulted in moderate flooding for Galesville and minor flooding for Black River Falls this weekend. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black River at Black River Falls. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 50.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:00 AM CDT Saturday was 53.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning and continue falling to 38.1 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 47.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 50.8 feet on 05/31/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 445 PM CDT.
